sentences.en: But he met instead a look of such mild benignity that he was left baffled.
sentences.cn: 可是他看到他的神色竟如此温和、宽厚,使他感到困惑莫解.

sentences.en: He looked upon me with so much humor and benignity that I could scarcely contain my satisfaction.
sentences.cn: 他是多么幽默地仁慈地瞧着我，我简直没办法抑制心头的满足。

sentences.en: He met instead a look of such mild benignity that he was left baffled.
sentences.cn: 他看到他的神色竟如此温和,宽厚使他感到困惑莫解.

sentences.en: However the social insurance system of justice still needs benignity to provide value guidance and humanistic environment for its operation.
sentences.cn: 然而，正义的社会保障制度，仍需仁慈为其运行提供价值引导和人文环境。

sentences.en: However, the social insurance system of justice still needs benignity to provide value guidance and humanistic environment for its operation.
sentences.cn: 然而，正义的社会保障制度，仍需仁慈为其运行提供价值引导和人文环境。

sentences.en: It is in vain for any man to usurp the name of Christian, without holiness of life, purity of manners, benignity and meekness of spirit.
sentences.cn: 任何人若没有圣洁的生活，正直的行为，仁慈与顺服的精神，那么僭取基督徒的名义是徒劳的。

sentences.en: Marked by utter benignity ; resembling or befitting an angel or saint.
sentences.cn: 以非常仁慈为特点；类似于或者适合于天使或者圣人。

sentences.en: Unfamiliar person very benignity of together engaged.
sentences.cn: 陌生的人很亲切的在一起忙碌着.

sentences.en: We now of no scripture which records the pure benignity of the gods on a New England winter night.
sentences.cn: 但没有一本书记录了新英格兰的冬夜，尽管它是上天仁慈的恩惠。

words.tran_cn: 良性的；仁慈的；有益的；和蔼的
